intro: Tetragonia inermis, commonly known as New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in cooking. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Tetragonia inermis is valued both for its culinary uses and its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
